title: Is the Indian kid 'Lydian Nadhaswaram' the world's best pianist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Chennai's piano prodigy Lydian Nadhaswaram wins the US talent reality show The World's Best; see pics Lydian Nadhaswaram has become a popular name ever since he appeared on The Ellen DeGeneres Show. The Chennai based pianist won the American reality show The World's Best. Read on to know more.  Lydian Nadhaswaram has been declared the winner of the US-based talent reality show The World's Best. Along with the trophy Lydian also took home the prize money worth $1-million!  Lydian's winning performance included playing two pianos blindfolded at an unbelievable speed! For those who don't know, Lydian is the son of the Tamil music director Varshan Satish.  Lydian made the country proud by beating South Korea’s Kukkiwon AKA The Flying Taekwondo Masters.  The 13-year-old piano prodigy studies at the KM Music Conservatory in Chennai, which is founded and is run by Oscar winning music director AR Rahman.  Captured here with one of the judges Drew Barrymore. The other front line judges included Faith Hill and RuPaul Charles.  Lydian Nadhaswaram took the world by storm with his unbelievable piano playing skills as he appeared on The Ellen DeGeneres Show. The young boy from Chennai wowed the audience with his magical performance on Mozart's Turkish March. Lydian started his musical journey with drums at the age of two.  Did we mention Lydian did all this with a blindfold on? Yes, the 13-year-old played Mozart's Turkish March blindfolded which left the audience speechless! His performance was indeed worth a watch! Lydian had earlier performed in front of the likes of Drew Berrymore, RuPaul, and Faith Hill on The World's Best, a talent-based reality TV show.  It was a lifetime experience for Lydian Nadhaswaram to be on Ellen's show as he himself is a big fan of the American actress and TV host. The next Mozart in the making also received a standing ovation from the audience on the show.  Lydian who started off with drums can also play guitar, tabla, and mrudangam.  India's musical maestro AR Rahman has described him as one of India’s treasures!  Lydian's viral video playing the piano blindfolded has so far garnered 2.7 million views and more than 16k shares!  On the show, Lydian revealed that he can play two songs on two different pianos simultaneously! Can you believe it!  The young pianist is definitely to watch out for in the coming years!

Not even close, probably never going to be. His interpretations of classical music is extremely ordinary, I don’t even know how someone could compare him with Daniel Barenboim, Murray Perahia, Arthur Rubinstein, Martha Argerich, Pollini, etc. You can only play Flight of the Mumblebee with zero phrasing or articulation so many times before someone figures out you’re overrated and ordinary. And giving him the title “best pianist”, which doesn’t exist, shows you know absolutely nothing about music.
